Part Vendors

When it comes to part vendors for PC, there a lot of different suppliers. On this page we show you some popular suppliers for the main hardware of the computer so you can learn about the companies history and brand. When you are building a PC, selecting the correct supplier for what you want is important.

Intel

Intel was established all the way back in 1968, and has now over 83 900 employees and a revenue over 8.2 billion dollars. Together with AMD they control the market of Central Precessing Units. Intel produces CPUs for a wast majority of other companies. For example are they used in most DELL, Apple and HP. Those are just some of Intel's customers, of course their CPUs are known across the globe for being powerful and reliable.

AMD

AMD, Advanced Micro Devices, is, just like Intel, a vast producer of microprosessors. The company was founded in 1969, about a year after Intel, and has over 12 000 employees. AMD had a revenue of 6.5 billion dollars in 2011. Over the years AMD has fought alongside Intel for their place in the market and it has created a very competitive environment. AMD is known for being overall a bit cheaper than Intel, but they are more than powerful enough for your average and above-average user.

Seagate

Seagate was established in 1979 and is the company that the world trusts to store their lives. They are the main producers of storage devices that we all use oh-so much. Devices like HDD, hard disk drive and SSD, solid state drive. Seagate also sells entire storage systems to other enterprises and businesses.

Acer

Acer was founded 40 years ago, in 1976, and they produce a huge variety of devices. Desktops, laptops, netbooks, servers, smartphones, different monitors and so much more. With a revenue of 263.8 billion dollars in 2015 you can easily say that their products are quite popular.

TP-Link

TP-Link is the worlds number 1 provider of consumer WiFi networking devices. It was established in 1996 and the name TP-link is based on the concept of "twisted pair link", a kind of elecromagnetic cabling. TP-link products include such products as wireless router, ADSL, range extenders, routers, switches, IP cameras, powerline adapters, wireless adapters and many more. All you need for your PC from the network department you can find.

Zyxel

Zyxel is a company that was founded by Dr. Shun-I Chu in 1989 and he is to this day the administrative director. Zyxel, no unlike TP-link is focusing on the network parts for PCs. Zyxel is focusing on innovation and customer-centricity and they developed the world's first integrated 3-in-1 data/fax/voice modem back in 1992. They ability to adapt and innovate within network technology is what makes this company stand out.

Samsung

Did you know that Samsung started out in 1938 as an export company? A lot has changed about this company over the years and maybe that is why they have a huge variety of products. Even though Samsung may be best known for their home elctronics they are known for prodcusing great monitors and HDDs/SSDs.

Corsair

Corsair was founded in 1994 and high-end cooling, memory, storage units, power supply products and cases. They also manufacture a variety of peripherals like keyboards, mices, headsets and mouse pads. Corsair had a revenue of 455.2 million dollars in 2011, and with a number of 800 employees, this is very impressing numbers.

Nvidia

Nvidia is your go-to producer of GPUs, Graphical Precessing Units, and has been around since 1993. Nvidia do not actually produce the GPU, but they produce the processor in them. Nvidia is also called the inventor of GPUs, and its easy to forget that computers did no used to have a component solely focusing on the visual technology. They have also had a huge success with the GeForce series which continue to push the limits of GPUs. If you are looking for high-end GPUs, Nvidia is a great place to start.

Gigabyte

Gigabyte Technology was founded in 1986 and was one of the pioneers within the motherboard industry. In 2013 they had a revenue of 1.7 billion dollars, with a total number of around 7 100 workers. Gigabyte has a total shipment of 4.8million motherboards in the first quarter of 2015, meanwhile Asus shipped around 4.5 million motherboards. The company was also ranked 17th in "Taiwan's 2010 Top 20 Global Brands" by the Taiwan External Trade Development Council.
